title: Good complex shame about the noise.
review: This was a good complex with swimming pool, bar , day and evening entertainment. Entertainment was coordinated by Danny and he was fantastic. Evening entertainment was a nightly show of various tribute bands/ artists. Our favourite was Ian James as Michael Buble and Robbie Williams. The apartments are in a really good location - Cala Gran beach is 5 mins away and the pedestranised area where majority of the restaurants and bars is10 mins away. There are restaurants/ bars close by as well as smaller type spa Shops. Bus stop for Palma etc. is also close by. We stayed in a one bedroomed apartment which was good value for money 500 euros. Our apartment could have done with a lick of paint but it was clean. The kitchen had 2 rings which was adequate for us and plenty of pans,…

title: Mixed feelings
review: We arrived back last week from a week at these apartments and unfortunately I agree with the last reviewer's comments on the noise from Hollywood Bar.  We stayed in block seven and had to complain twice about the noise from the karaoke until we were finally moved to another apartment.  It isn't just the music that's disruptive but also the general noise the bar makes throwing out bottles and closing up.  Deliveries then early in the morning don't allow you to sleep in.  I hardly slept the nights we stayed in block seven.  On the other hand the staff were friendly and helpful, the apartments clean and in good condition, the pool area well maintained and the evening entertainment quite good.  Cala D'or is a great resort and I would definitely return - just not to Es Ravells!

title: Don't go in you intend to sleep before 4am
review: We arrived on 29th May for 1 week for a chill out for us and our son who was doing g.c.s.e's when he got back, we picked the apartments because of Majorca's law on no music after 12 but this wasnt the case. After the first night of karaoke til 3.30am from the HOLLYWOOD BAR downstairs (under seperate managment) we went to reception to ask if we could be moved to a quieter apartments but were told they were fully booked, didnt appear that way but we took their word for it, was told if we had anymore noise to come to reception after 2AM and they would get the police to sort it out. After 5 nights of 3 am and later of karaoke for the HOLLYWOOD BAR downstairs we went back to reception to get the police to come and sort it. Needless to say the police didnt come but the bar did turn…

title: Better than the two star rating from Thomson
review: Just arrived home from our two week holiday. We had a brilliant time, apt was better than we had expected. We had a one bedroom apt in block 7. We were overlooking pool and entertainment area. Pool was excellent, clean with plenty of free needs and shade. Could be noisy at night if you were not a lover of some of the entertainment, but that is I guess personal preference! Get some ear plugs when Lady Go Go is on as I'm sorry but she can't sing! But the entertainment is free. One point to note is that TVs were installed in all rooms last week. All staff were helpful, maid service was excellent.   We had our evening meal in a different restaurant each of our 14 nights and we only tried half of them in Cala D'Or.  Try the Hollywood Bar mown stairs, good breakfasts, good bear, and…

title: value for money
review: just returned from a 10 day holiday at these apartments, i cant fault them in any way, the staff were so friendly and helpfull, the lovely blond woman at reception goes out her way to help you, wee will be back.  thomas/yvonne    scotland.

title: Stayed in May 2010 - Excellent budget accomodation
review: I stayed here with my girlfriend in early may 2010. Good location with lots of choice for food locally. The beach is two minutes walk away with lots of sun loungers. The room we stayed in had the biggest balcony ever, the bedroom was large and basic. The kitchen had very basic clean facilities I.e. It only has a two ring hob to cook on. Pans, plates and cutlery provided. Lounge was comfortable with dinner table and chairs. Balcony overlooks the pool and nightly live entertainment. The bathroom is the smallest I have ever experienced but it has been really well decorated I.e. Nice Spanish tiles and granite worktop...   Live entertainment every night was excellent with a full bar. The Robbie Williams/Michael Buble tribute singer Ian James was simply excellent!   FOOD - The choice…

title: Great Apartments
review: Stayed in these apartments the last week in September, Lady manager very friendly and helpful as was the reception staff, especially Miguel, the apartments are nice & clean and we had a huge balcony overlooking the pool & entertainment, there are some restaurants in Cala Dor as cheap or expensive as you want, everyone raved about Fernando's but we found that the food was the best at The Pirate, although the drinks were expensive. Cala Do'r was very quite in the evening I suppose as it was nearing the end of the season but the beaches were busy in the day. A word of warning DO NOT USE THE SPAR in the middle of Cala Do'r, this is next to a Santander ATM and opposite a perfume shop, the owner in there rips you off every time, she overcharged us by 13 Euros the 1st time we went in…

title: Cheap and excellent for purpose
review: This was a great place to stay if you are looking for inexpensive self catering. I was upgraded to a one bedroom apartment having booked a studio.  The room was a little basic, no frills, but clean, comfortable,  and the balcony was great.  Excellent location with a short walk to the main amenities of the resort.  There are only two electric rings to the 'cooker', which was very slow to work, but they fixed it by the next day - the hotest setting is at 1.00.  Do bring anything you personally need to cook with - eg cheese grater, sharp knife, etc.  If you like 'hotel entertainment' then ask for block 6 as this overlooks the pool where they entertainers perform.  However, if you don't, ask for block 4 which is furthest away.  I found if you close all the doors and put your own…

title: cheap and cheerfull
review: es ravells is run by a lovely lady and has many very friendly and helpfull staff we took our 17 month old son and when we didnt have a bed as we,d booked a studio(mistakenly) we were very kindly moved to a bigger room with a very large balcony!! the resort is a fantastic place if your looking for a lovely beach many nice restaurants and a very relaxing place then this is ideal, the only drawback was the transfer nearly 2 hours due to many drop offs. the ae ravells rooms are very basic self catering but you couldnt cook nothing really as there is only 2 small rings! cooker/toaster you must pay for. but i would recomend this for a cheap getaway we paid 580 for 2 adults and a baby beg of sept and we were vaery happy for what we got.

title: On the whole we were more than happy with the apartment, location and weather and would definately be happy to return.
review: We stayed in a 2 room apartment which was spacious and clean.  Cleaners came every other day.  Cooking facilities were basic - 2 ring hob and a fridge but adequate.  No Kettle !!! Our room was 6108 which was a corner one and had a balcony all the way around two sides, this got the sun all day. For a budget apartment we were very pleased, it provided just enough but nothing more, you can 'hire' hairdryers from reception.   The evening entertainment was excellent and we heard lots of good comments about the quality of childrens evening entertainment.   Bar and music finished by 12. Excellent location for town shopping and eating, loads of restaurants to choose from.  No street hawkers here to annoy you, you can actually browse at your leisure!  Yipee!! We hired a car, again very…

title: Excellent value for money
review: We found Es Ravells d'Or very nice and cozy apartment hotel. When checking in we actually got a bigger room than we were supposed to get (1 bedroom apartment). The air conditioned room was spacious and nice eventhough the view from the balcony wasn't much of a view. The kitchen had most of the equipments you need for cooking (fridge, small freezer, hot plates, forks, knives, spoons, pots, pans, cups and coffee making facilities).  The room was cleaned in every other day (with very strong chemicals). The pool area was clean and tempting. Like some people have written earlier the sunbeds were mostly taken. If you want to make sure you get one you might want to go to the pool area already in the morning. The pool was lovely and popular especially among families with children.…

title: Fabulous!!
review: We've just returned from our 4th visit to Cala Dor and this was by far the best! Maybe not the best accomodation but everything else was fab!  We were in block 7 on the top floor and had an amazing balcony which looked in 3 directions!! The accomodation is basic but 'it does what it says on the tin'. Location is perfect, staff were great, pool was always clean and Danny the entertainment rep looked after the kids really well. Entertainment at night is as good as you'll get anywhere for this type of holiday!! We would definitely return as it was the best value for money we've ever got!  Walshies is fab for a few drinks at night - the owner Layton has made it a very family friendly pub!! Its a must! La Fontanella (just below the apartments) is the best place we ate in!! All in all…

title: Spot on
review: Just had a week in a 1bed apartment in block2. Have no complaints at all.Basic accomodation but clean enough and cooking facilities at the bare minimum. Location  wise couldnt be any better. First time in Cala D'or but would definitely return and no qualms about going back to Es Ravells. Entertainment on offer not really my cup of tea but i still sat most nights having a beer and watching from our balcony.We took a travel kettle and ate out every night,plenty of cheap grub or some excellent restaurants within a few minutes walk.Of you want 5star pay 5star prices but if you want a reasonably priced self catering holiday i think these apartments would take some beating.

title: excellent for the money
review: Position: Excellent for all amenities Rooms: Basic but clean. No kettle or toaster if you are self catering. We used a pan to boil the water. Cleaned by friendly maids 3 times a week. Pool: Large and clean, Sunloungers are reserved altho policy says this is not allowed.  Entertainment: Daytime with Danny was excellent and we enjoyed the evening tribute acts except the awful Spanish Elvis" lol Poolside bar: Not cheap but food excellent and the staff make the holiday special, see pics of Paco. owerall excellent value for money. **TIP** Ask for a room with a pool view.

title: Central location for beach and town
review: Stayed at this hotel(?) for 10 days.  When we arrived at reception it had the all the makings of a hotel reception but that was it.  We were then redirected down the road to block 4.  This apartment had a balcony but we couldn't see anything from it.  When arriving in the room it was only made up for 2 people - not enough bedding or towels.  After going back to reception the receptionist arranged for the maid to call.  The apartment was pretty basic.  No mirror in the bedroom.  Pots and cutlery weren't very clean.   We had paid for half board accommodation.  Not having any details about the restaurant went back to reception again and was handed a "ticket" and advised that we had to eat at the hotel opposite.  The food there was ok but the spec for the Es Ravells should make it…

title: Didnt disappoint for the third time!
review: My fiancee and I stayed for a week at Es Ravell D'or, the third time we have stayed at this hotel. The rooms are basic and your not gonna be able to cook much in them butif your looking for a good base for your holiday and a relatively comfortable apartment, these are the apartments for you! The staff at the hotel are more than helpful and the manageress was very accomodating when we asked if we could change rooms to the one we got engaged in. She did everything she could to help us. The 'Tropical Gardens Bar' attached to the hotel and pool was again fantastic with daily afternoon and evening entertainment and bar and kitchen staff  that made our holiday! My only complaint would be that other hotel guests were up at 5am to put towels down on sun loungers, despite there being…

title: 10/10 for value.
review: Firstly, let me start by making sure you are aware that you are going self catering at the apartments! You dont get anything in the room unless you rent them at an expensive cost so please pack a travel kettle and toaster if you can. My wife and I knew we were going to eat out all of the time so these missing luxuries weren't reaaly a problem to us.  The rooms are of a good size, good bedroom, good dining area, the bathrooms are a squeeze at times and the kitchen area comprises of 2 hot rings and a sink. However none of this would distract us from the fact that these apartments were excellent value for money. Every apartment from what we could see appeared to have an excellent view of the nightly entertainment which was propably the best in cala d'or. the entertainment below the…

title: Excellent value for money!
review: This hotel is not the three-star standard it claims to be, but it's such good value for money, who cares!? Our room didn't smell great when we arrived, and the kitchen & crockery wasn't clean, but there were so many plus points that outweighed these. The location of the hotel is superb - slap bang in the middle of Cala d'Or, which is a lovely place. The pool is pleasant, but we were never there early enough to bag a lounger so tended to head to a lovely beach instead. The pool bar wasn't cheap - head into town and seek a local bar for cheaper drinks. Cala Gran is a lovely beach, but we usually went to the smaller, quieter cove next door.  The evening entertainment was a mixture of cheesy and hilarious, as was the karaoke in the bar next door - don't let the noise factor put you…

title: great value for money and brill location. can i go back please?!?!
review: Recently returned from a brillant week at The Es Ravells Apartments. I went with my friend and dad. We're both sixteen and the resort was great for all ages. The bar is fantastic! For me it was one of the best things of my holiday, especially the bar owner/manager Tony, so much fun! And all the rest of them were very welcoming. Never seemed a problem to find a sun lounger in the day, though some of them are more comfortable than others (the blue ones!). The apartments were fabulous, had a 1 bed apartment and had 2 huge balconies! Both which were in the sun, so could do some sunbathing there as well which was an added bonus, was like having your own villa! The only thing i would criticise about the apartments were the fact you have to pay for a kettle, toaster etc. All you got to…

title: Great value for money - exceeded expectations
review: I stayed with my boyfriend in a self catering studio apartment and didn't expect anything amazing considering how cheap it was. But it certainly exceed our expectations when we arrived. The lady at the hotel reception was very friendly and helpful and the room and bathroom were clean and well maintained. The best was the large terrace we had to ourselves which overlooked the tropical garden cocktail bar. The entertainment meant there was some noise in the evening but it ended promptly at midnight. Some of the cover bands/singers were good fun too.  The only let down was the bed which were two sofas we had to push together every night to make a twin double, and weren't too comfortable but ok. It didn't bother us too much as we only lazed all day on the beach anyway. There were…

title: Fantastic- loved it that much going back again in October
review: Good clean basic apartments with entertainment every night (some quite cheesy) well worth the money we paid, only 1 let down, you have to pay for any extra electrical equipment you require e.g. 12 euros for a loan of a toaster for the week, but if like us you only wanted to make a cup of tea/coffee in the morning we just boilet a saucepan of water.

title: Superb !!
review: We booked a 1 bedroom apartment which was very nice & spacious with a huge balcony. Lovely view over the pool (Block 6, Top Floor). My 4 year old daughter loved the pool and the entertainment at the tropical gardens. Extremely good value for money. Maid service 2/3 times per week but they only mop the bathroom floor not the whole apartment! Also beware of the free air conditioning.......It is only switched on during high season (July-August) which was never mentioned before we arrived and it would have been nice at night. Failing that, we would definately stay here again. Excellent holiday!

title: Brilliant !
review: From beginning to end a superb holiday - OK so the rooms are basic but they are spotlessly clean, we booked a one bed roomed apartment, wonderful large bathroom, great main bedroom and living accommodation, balcony overlooked the pool area.   Pool area was again spotless, plenty of sunbeds, but would imagine they are scarce during the high season (School Holiday time) pool gets the sun from early morning till late at night. Bar staff were are very friendly and approachable, food in the bar area was good too. Entertainment on an evening was first class, and proved popular as it was nice and busy on an evening with a great atmosphere !  Cannot complain about the location central to everything - people who complain about noise from bars, what do you expect, you are on holiday, and…

title: Loved it!!!
review: My review is a little late... Me and my girlfriend travelled here in June 2008 for 10 nights and it was one of the best holidays we've had!   Firstly Cala D'or is is our favourite resort. Its small beaches are gorgeous, turquoise sea... white sands and the boat trip to cala mondrago is a must! They take you to all the coves along the coast.   There are so many restaurants to choose from and all the food we had was good, bodega was excellent! There are also many bars, which vary from chilled out family type to the more lively in the square, I must say the night that Spain won Euro 2008 while I was over there was a night i'll never forget!  The apartments are spacious with a big balcony. No they are not 5star but you only sleep there! The pool was a great place to relax and soak…

title: Good Value - basic but well located.
review: Just returned from a short break in Cala D'or staying at Es Ravells and had a great time. This hotel is pretty basic but if, like me, your holiday is more about the local town, its restaurants and bars, the local beaches, days by the pool etc. then you're likely to love it. We arrived around lunchtime and check-in went quick and smooth. The room we had was a studio which is basically one room with a balcony and a bathroom. The bathroom was excellent, the main room had a small kitchen which you couldn't really cook in (no kettle / oven / toaster etc) but had a sink and a fridge which was all we used. There are no beds in the studios as such just 2 of those sofa's that double as beds which we had to push together to make a kind of big cot! A bit odd - I wouldn't like this…

title: Fab accomodation, cheap enough & perfect location!!!
review: Travelled to Es Ravells in Sept last year with my Dad for a week… I must say I was so impressed and so glad I chose this accommodation  I honestly can not fault these apartments... The apartments were basic, but clean and had all the essentials you would need on a self catering holiday! I did originally book a studio as this holiday was for me and my ex-boyfriend but we split about 2 months before we was due to go, so my Dad come to the rescue and came with me, therefore we really needed a one bedroom apartment. So I emailed the Es Ravells directly on the off chance they would let me upgrade (I was willing to pay the difference) but I never heard back from them but when we arrived they had upgraded us to a one bedroom apartment free of charge - I thought this was fantastic…

title: brill holiday
review: stayed here in sept 2009 with my partner, on arrival we were greeted by charlie who was very helpfull, swimming pool in tropical garden was fab food great, pp chaves across the road is a great place to eat. the bar next door was great fun, martin had us laughing all nite.. as for the complaints about the beds, we thought they were very comfy.. all in all we will definatly be back again, looking forward to seeing you again. gavin quinn

title: Lovely Hotel
review: Amazing swimming pool! Lovely staff Masssssive balcony! A little noisy from the bar next door at night,

title: Good and Bad Points
review: We are so pleased that your thoughts regarding your stay with us, were wery positive. We sould like to think that we can welcome you back in the very near future.

title: brilliant
review: After half an hour in our ground floor studio apartment we noticed a mass amount of ants crawling on the floor. Looking out onto our 'balcony area' (on the ground floor so in front of a fence) we noticed a tree where there was a stream of ants crawling in and out of the tree, making their way from the tree, to the floor, over our balcony and into our rooms.  We had arrived at our room quite early because we hired a car, and so got there before other holidaymakers made it from their tour operators buses. We decided to ask if we could be moved to another floor that wasn't on the ground floor, expecting it to not be a problem as some of the rooms hadn't been allocated yet.  To this the lady at the desk told us no, we cannot change our room. If we wanted to move to a different room…

title: fab holiday
review: my review is a little late but just want to say as a family we have been going to es ravell for over 10 years and love it ,we have also taken friends with us and they have been a few times with us now.Everyone is so friendly and we have made some good friends.They always try to give us the same apartment whenever possible.Beaches are lovely yes sometimes a little crowded.Restaurant below ravells good food, we go there a few times to eat.My husband and i are looking at going again in june.Look forward to seeing you all soon.Cath and Paul Hewitt ,Great Sutton.

title: Good value, great location
review: We are highly delighted that you have chosen our complex during so many years . We must be doing something right. We see you have booked again for this year. We look forward to having you once more as our guests.

title: Never again
review: Stayed here in September 2009 on arrival complex was ok ,but have never felt so ripped of on any holiday before ,how came can you charge for a kettle & toaster in a self catering apartment.They were even selling the old books games etc that people have left.Saying that the entertainment was great.

title: Never again !
review: Just returned from Es Ravells apartments in cala d'0r Mallorca . apartment was nice size but very basic and could do with a lick of paint here and there . Chuck out the chintz as they say ! No kettle supplied had to hire one from reception for 10 euros for the week and was only a travel type took ages to boil . Good size balconies with 1 table and 3 chairs as per the norm . Good air con system which is free . But the beds are naff to the extreme . Mattresses made of 5 inch thick rock solid foam , and i mean solid . Not one good evenings sleep could myself and my wife get . Please please please invest in some decent mattresses they just might help you to keep people coming back ! we went for a relaxing week but came back shattered from lack of sleep .  Nice area but everything so…

title: Very Nice Apartments
review: We apprecieate your constructive critiscm concerning your holiday with us. Every year we do our utmost to improve the standard of the facilities at the complex.

title: a great holiday
review: Me and my girlfriend have just returned from a ten day stay at es ravells apartments, we used resorthoppa to get there and back and would recommend them. We had a 1 bedroom apartment which was very spacious and had great air con, our balcony had a pool view which was a nice size  overlooking the tropical gardens, the entertainment ends around half 12 so dont expect to get to sleep untill 1 when they rearrange the sun loungers. The kitchen was ok, we brought our own kettle coz we knew from trip advisor that we wouldnt have 1 in our room, also no toaster, tip - bring a tea towel. The reception staff are very friendly and helpful. We bought a map for 1 euro from reception but then found them free at a bar in the marina, so dont make that mistake. The pool belongs to the tropical…

title: 4th year in a row love it next year i will make it 5 in a row with friends
review: We are glad that you had a good holiday at Ravells d'Or and thank you for your very positive comments. We hope that when the pound against the euro is stronger you will pay us another visit. Many thanks once again.

title: What a Gem!
review: This hotel is conveniently located by he Karaoke bar Hollywoods in Cala d'or. It is close to 2 beaches and the marina and town as well. It was an absolute bargain and we booked through alpha rooms. The lady on reception is english but speaks perfect spanish! You can call the hotel and book through her as well - i will probably do that next time.   The pool is lovely and the food at the pool bar is ok - although the ice cream parlour a 2 second walk away is the BEST!   The rooms are large and very clean all of the facilities are in good condition and the balconys are large.  A fabulous budget hotel and i will be using this again!

title: Nice location, clean rooms and good evening entertainment
review: We would like you to know that we appreciate your comments on our complex!!! Our aim is to please and we will continue to do that. Into 2010. Many thanks for your support.

title: FAB APARTMENTS AND LOCATION BY THE CAVIES FAMILY
review: My wife and I stayed here for 7 nights in July 2009.  The room was clean, cool (aircon working fine) and an above average bathroom.  The single beds were basic but ok; I'm 6'3" so I had to lie diagonally.  We slept ok.  Cooking facilities were also basic but we did get a working kettle and a toaster, both of which I was lead to beleive were extras from reception.  Not this time!  The room had a balcony which overlooked the pool.  The plastic chairs and table are what you come to expect, urgh, I wish they would do better there.  There was a downside - The evening entertainment next to the pool is on 7 days a week and ends at midnight.  So if you want to go to bed earlier than midnight you will have to put up with pretty loud music.  We also found the childrens entertainer lady…

title: Nope, not for us
review: Could we just say that we appreciate your comments and are delighted that your stay with us was satisfactory.

title: One of the best holidays ever!
review: We have just recently returned from a fabulous holiday at Es Ravells D'or Apartments.  The staff and facilities at these apartments are great.  The staff are very friendly and provide you with all the information you need.  We had a great apartment with a huge balcony overlooking the pool and entertainment (Room 6201).  The apartments are very clean and are very good value for money.  We will definately be returning to these apartments next year.  Cala D'or itself is a great place for couples or families.  The beaches are excellent.  Plenty of very nice restaurants with lots of choice.  Didn't want to come home - wished we had booked two weeks.  Thanks Es Ravell's D'or for making our holiday an excellent one.

title: Cheap, Cheerfull, Nice beach, perfect with Kids
review: Travelled to Es Ravell with the better 1/2 and 2 young children (<5) for seven days at the end of may. Apartments were basic but clean with functional kitchen (although the hotplates did take me a couple of meals to work out).  Room had huge balcony which was lovely.  The privately run pool  is really nice and well maintained and the glorious beach is only a short walk (<5mins) away (tip - there is a path next to the pool which takes you through some gardens directly to the beach, saves walking down the road with kids).  Entertainment for the kids was great and the lady who provided it was brilliant, she played in the pool with the children during the afternoon and did the Black Lace style entertainment form about 8ish.  The tribute acts afterwards were always well supported…

title: Brilliant Holiday
review: Thank you so much for your felicgtful comments on our apartment complex, and th resort of Cala d'Or. It really assists us, when people take the time and trouble to let us know exactly what they think. In this way, we are able to improve our standardseach year, in the hope that our loyal guests will return once more to stay with us. Many thanks once again.

title: Good Reviews Justified
review: Just got back from Es Ravells and loved it, basic clean but friendly staff and great entertainment. The rooms are ok for a base and somewhere to sleep, there is plenty to do and see so you will not be in there much anyway! as for the ants? well you get ants in Mallorca just as you would in any hot country!! just not a big deal really. We wil be going again we loved the whole experience.  p.s tribute bands were great.

title: Absolutely lovely holiday - great entertainment :-)
review: To our most welcome Guest, we truly appreciate that you have chosen our establishment in which to spend your vacation. We hope that your stay with us has been most satisfactory, and that all your needs have been met! We would be delighted to receive any suggestions you may have, on how to improve our services for the future.  We hope that you will choose us once moer for any holidays that you may be contepplating. In hope of seeing you in the near future.

title: Fabulous! Can't wait to go back!
review: I searched long and hard for accomodation on the internet for myself and my husband as it was to be our first visit to Cala D'or and didn't want to be disappointed. Made list after list and kept coming back to Es Ravell d"or. But it was the cheapest - surely it was going to be a let down and him indoors would not be happy !?!!  After a drag of a transfer from the airport we were very pleasantly suprised by the reception area & the welcome we were given by the English lady on duty. Michael was most impressed that it was 24 hour reception and they had books for sale and also leaflets and postcards. Not thrilled that we had to pay for a map but perhaps we would have come across a free one if we had waited.  We were given a welcome pack and our keys and headed for our room on the…

title: Basic but clean
review: Booked a week at es Ravells d'or at the last minute. Apatment was basic but clean with a massive terrace. Some problems with Ants in the kitchen area and it was a bit annoying to have to hire the safe and kettle.   Resort itself was very quiet at the end of September.

title: A bit of a kip!
review: We had been to Cala D'Or around 7 years ago, and having had a great holiday first time round, were keen to go back.   First problem arose when the transfer driver chucked us off the bus at Club Martha's at 6am in the morning, despite our protestations that it was the wrong hotel. Between our limited Spanish and his limited English, there was no arguing the point. Luckily, when we got inside the receptionist was really helpful and ordered us a taxi to Es Ravells.  The room at Es Ravells was a bit of shocker - we'd stayed in pretty basic accommodation before at this resort, but we hadn't been told it was a studio apartment with what was essentially two sofas to sleep on. Cooking facilities weren't great - no way that a meal (however simple) could be prepared on the very weak hob.…

title: Great Time.
review: Just returned from a great holiday at Es Ravells. lovely clean apartment, free entertainment every night by good tribute bands, and the restaurant "Rafaels" is superb. I can highly recommend the food and the service.

title: Cheap & Cheerful
review: Just got back from a great week at Es Ravell's. Myself and my husband booked a one bedroom apartment and it was very spacious with loads of storage - tip, don't book a studio apartment and then complain your beds are sofas in the same room as the kitchen, that is what a studio is wherever you go!  Lovely bathroom with great shower. Cleaners came 3 times in a week, changed towels, mopped floor etc.  Beds - yes, they are a bit hard, but we both managed to sleep on them fine for a week.  Kitchen - rubbish, but I don't go on holiday to cook. We've got our own travel kettle, and I boiled a couple of eggs and made a few sandwiches, but that's as far as it goes for me! Fridge has an ice-box in it if you're taking freezer blocks for a cool bag (good idea for beach, trust me - the state…

title: You get what you pay for
review: Just got back from our stay in Es Ravells and loved it I wouldnt say i was short of money but me and my partner and both of our parents wanted a CHEAP getaway and thats what we got. We all stayed in studios yes very basic but what you expect for a hundred quid. There are a few ants knocking about but nowt major. The rooms were very clean nice big balcony newly fitted bathrooms, the sofa beds were fine just as comfy as your normal spanish hotel bed. To be honest the rooms were only there to sleep and make a bit of dinner in them as cala do'r has so many things to do, a superb choice of resteraunts, bars and things to see. People say its pricey but how can anything be pricey when you come from England. My only gripe was the beds round the pool are in desperate need of updating it…

title: Tribute!!!!
review: Just got back from 2 weeks at Ravells.  I can honestly say it was a brilliant holiday.  Ok so the apartment was a bit basic but remember when you booked it is only a 2 star!!!! but it was cleaned every day.  There was always plenty of room by the pool and it was always kept very clean and tidy.  The entertainment at the Tropical Gardens I have to say was EXCELLENT we saw Abba, Westlife, Take That ,Robbie Williams, Rod Stewart , Blue Brothers, Neil Diamond and a whole lot more and as tribute acts they were very good.  The resort itself was a bit hilly but worth the walk.  Noddy trains were a good way of getting your bearings......

title: Like a Carry On Film!
review: The following is a true account. I arrived at Es Ravells, Cala D'Or on friday 29 August 2008. I had booked a 'studio apartment' for myself and my two children for a week. This was on the ground floor and consisted of a small room with two grotty tartan sofa beds and a 1960's fold up metal camp bed. The 'kitchen' was in the same room and comprised a sink and two electric rings. No kettle. No toaster. No microwave. These could be hired from reception for extortionate fees (10 Euros to rent a toaster for the week!). The fridge had an ants nest in it. It was like something out of a Carry On film. I had never seen any holiday accommodation so bad. The bathroom was clean at least.  I asked the receptionist if I could upgrade. Either that or I was going to fly back to the UK that…

title: Fab resort
review: Myself and my partner (in our 30's) got back from a week's stay at Es Ravell D'Or Apartments, cant really fault the room - although our bed was 2 sofa's.  Room was clean and the maid came every other day.  I didnt spend any time around the pool as was more for familys with kids - to be honest a bit tacky, could not get a sunlounger at all and everyone seemed on top of each other! The resort was great, plenty of restaurants, bars - although we found a bit pricey. Beaches are lovely although get there early if you want a bed/umbrella as this were all gone when we got there (about 11ish).   We hired a scooter, very reasonable 29 euros for a day, and you can get around to see a lot more of the island. Not much of night life though after midnight.   Over all a great holiday with lots…

title: hotel average/ tour operators horrendous!!
review: Just returned from a week in cala d or at Es Ravell Apartments. As previously mentioned the accomodation is very basic, but clean, balconies are great, but the beds are rock solid!!   I went away with my mum and 6 and 8 year old neices and as the beds were so uncomfortable, we ended up sleeping in the lounge on the setees, 2 of us on each!! Not ideal as I was just under 6 months pregnant, and unfortunately as a result am now suffering with bad back pain..The other issue we had with the apartments was the invasion of ants, we came back from the pool one afternoon to find hundreds (I kid u not) of ants marching across the apartment, reception told us that every apartment had them at the moment, and issued us with a pest killer foam!!   The pool area was fine and the staff were…

title: Perfect for families
review: We stayed here with our four year old and just got back.  This place has everything you need for a family with young children to enjoy.  OK, the accommodation is basic but we got the one bedroomed apartment for the same price as the studios that seem to get bad press elsewhere in these reviews.  The 'kitchen' is an afterthought and we didn't use the cooker once as there was plenty of reasonably priced cafes, bars and restaurants to hand.  The bathroom seems to be the most recent upgrade as it is more contemporary and finished to a higher standard; plus the shower was great and never ran cold.  The balcony was open to the neighbours but this proved a plus as our inquisitive little one chatted to the kids from neighbouring apartments.  The receptionist was helpful and never seemed…

title: A Place To Chill!
review: Just returned from a short break  to Cala D'or to see our daughter who works in the resort.  We were looking for somewhere to stay that was cheap, clean and well maintained. We got all this and more from the ES RAVELLS Apartments.  It is very well positioned close to the beach and all the shops, bars and resturants. The pool is fantastic with no towel watch and big enough for everyone. The friendly staff gave all the services and more with a smile on their faces and the entertainment was top notch with the likes of the temptations to the spice girls catering for all.  If you want a cheap night  - ask for a pool view room high floor overlooking the stage. Get some beer and pizzas and sit on the good sized balcony and enjoy the show. Cala D'or itself, has everything you need in a…

title: Love Cala d`or. -  2nd visit.
review: This was our 2nd holiday at Es Ravell D`or apartments.  Me and my partner went with our 3 daughters aged 13, 20 & 22.  We had such a fantastic time in 2006, when Gareth & Ellie were our entertainment staff,that we just had to go back again. Even though there was live entertainment every night at Tropical Gardens, what  WAS missing was entertainment staff. We feel there would have been more audience participation if there had been.  Apart from that ,our holiday was what we expected. I do agree with other reviewers that the sun loungers could do with being renewed but the pool was excellent and cleaned regularly.  I do think that a lot of people are not aware that Tropical Gardens (and therefore the entertainment) is owned & run (by Tony) independently from the apartments,so to be…

title: Never Again
review: Worst hotel I have ever stayed at and worst holiday ever !  Hotel room absolutely stank of foist, no view and electricity went off every time we plugged in our appliances, especially hair drier. Hotel staff were unfriendly, sunbeds were so old dirty and uncomfortable that we preferred to lie on the concrete.  Prices at hotel were ridiculous, 1.80 euro for a small bottle of water.  Resort itself was overpriced and boring.  The money we spent on this holiday would have paid for us a Caribbean Cruise - Never again !

title: Happy hol for 2nd year running
review: After visiting last year and being so impressed we booked and went back for a 2nd visit and were not disspointed.  I agree with a previous reviewer about the need for new loungers and the prices in the bar area being abit steep but bearing in mind the overall prices, the facilities and the great entertainment I am not complaining!  Tony the bar owner is constantly striving to ensure everyone is being served, enjoying themselves and joining in.  The reception staff are english, only to happy to help with anything you want/need and friendly and helpfull.  Particulary usefull is being able to buy old magazines and 2nd hand lilos, boats etc as well as having internet access for 1euro for 20mins so you can still keep in touch with the uk.  Think we might even go back again next year!

title: Would not go back!
review: You may find this review surprising since every other review listed on this site gives a glowing reference for Revells.  You may be inclined to ignore what i have to say, but of course thats your choice.  I stayed at Revells last week with my father (June 2008).  We booked a late deal on-line and were allocated a studio apartment, which i was told had two beds. Although we booked very late, the price was still reasonably expensive imo (i have been fortunate in that i have travelled extensively).  On arriving into the Studio, my father and I, looked at ourselves a little bit in shock.  The studio apartment had no rooms.  It was an all in 1, apartment.  The two beds were sofa beds, that did not pull out.  They were quite hard, and as our holiday progressed discovered that we were…

title: Good value
review: Just back from a week at Es Ravells and can't really argue with anything that hasn't already been said. The rooms are fairly basic but I've stopped in worse. They are cleaned three times a week depending on when you arrive, so for us arriving on a Saturday, the maid called on Sunday, Tuesday and Thursday.  Only down side really was the condition of the sun beds around the pool - they were minging! Hand on heart I don't know how people could lie on them as some of them were broken and almost all of them had black mould encrusted into them.  Luckily the beach at Cala Gran is only a 5 minute walk away but if you want two sun beds and a parasol it will set you back E11.60 a day.  The entertainment at the Tropical Gardens is ok depending on which night you hit on, but there are…

title: Fantastic!
review: This is the best place to stay for a break.  The apartments are basic as per other reviews, but are clean and tidy.  This is the 4th time we have stayed here.  We come year on year and never have anything bad to say about the place!  the entertainment in Tropical Gardens is great, the bar is expensive, but if you do find yourself lucky enough to be placed in the apartments overlooking the entertainment, then this will save you loads of money as everyone sits on the balconies and drinks their own!.  The beds are the only downside!  Es Ravell Dor...please spend some money and improve them....please!!!  Booked again for next year...

title: Excellent Es ravells!
review: Just back from ten scorching days in Cala D'Or, staying at Es Ravells apartments.Wonderfull!! We requested a quiet upper level one bedroom apartment and that is exactly what we were given.Spotlessly clean,excellent air con,spacious with lots of wardrobe space.Yes.. the cooking facilities are limited to two electric rings, no toaster or kettle, but we managed fine,we took a travel kettle with us although one could be hired from reception.It depends which company you book with if you are charged or not.No TV,but again who wants to watch CNN or eurosports on holiday.I took my portable DVD player and played music and films whenever I wanted a break from the heat and boyyyy was it hot!!!We had three very private sun terraces with the apartment, so we chose to get an all over tan up…

title: Didn't want to leave!
review: My boyfriend and I stayed at es ravell d'or for a week in August and it was one of the best holidays we've had.  We were a bit apprehensive after hearing some tales of it being over priced and boring but I have to say it was brilliant.  The area was fantastic just a short walk to everything you could possibly need, and as a young couple we never ran out of things to do.  The pool area is kept very clean and the pool itself is excellent.  The 'Tropical Gardens' bar which is attached to the hotel is also fantastic and the food is lovely and all the staff are very friendly.  The entertainment is great for the kids through the day if you have any, and the tribute bands on night time are a good laugh and some were pretty impressive!   The beach was quite crowded so we tended to stay…

title: Nice place but wont be returning
review: We (Family -2 adults, 2 children 9 & 5) have recently got back from our week long stay here at Es Ravells D'or & after having read a number of reviews i was heartened that it was not too uncomplimentary, however I need to inform those that are reading this of the facts when considering choosing this accomodation:  The Complex is centrally located in Cala D'or within 800metre (8min Walk) to Cala Gran beach, 15Min walk to Cala Esmerelda. The Apartment has a 24hr reception that has public payable access to the internet (€1=30mins). The rooms are Spacious, Clean & very presentable with A/C. However as advertised as a self catering apartment, there are a number of items not available as standard Self catering appliances. The rooms have Plates, cutlery, glasses, Saucepan, 2 pots, 2…

title: Peak season
review: Our apt was good - a one-bedroom on the top floor with a huge and very private balcony. The apts are basic but they are clean and have very good air-conditioning. No complaints at all about it.  If you get allocated apts in the blocks nearest reception, you will be much closer to the 'entertainment  centres' ie. the Tropical Gardens and the Hollywood Bar. They are both very noisy but everything shuts down at midnight. Obviously, it depends what you want - it seemed that many people - whose balconies overlooked the stage at the Tropical Gardens , sat out on them every night and watched the shows from the comfort of their own balcony. Much cheaper than paying bar prices downstairs! Overall, a good place to stay if you want to be right at the heart of things - near the beach, shops…

title: brilliant
review: brilliant holiday,been here twice in the last 8 months,cant beat the place.booked again for two more holidays next year.

title: Fab family location
review: Myself, husband and 4 yr old son have just returned from a lovely week in the Es Ravells Apartments in Cala D'Or.  They are ideal for families or couples - very relaxing during the day, no fighting for sunbeds , friendly, attentive staff, a lovely pool area with tropical gardens and only a few minutes walk from both the resort 'centre' and the lovely beach. Free kids animations are provided both on an afternoon (12-3.00pm) and evening as well as very good shows and 'tribute' bands for all the family from 10pm until midnight every night.  Anyone wanting to get to sleep before midnight would struggle but we just 'paced' ourselves accordingly - we are not a 'party animals' type family and went out for dinner each evening, but thoroughly enjoyed our night cap back at the 'Tropical…

title: great family holiday!
review: after reading a few of the reviews on this hotel before i went i was a little worried, but none of those worries were founded. our hotel apartment was clean and well equipt, ours included a small living area and a dining table which was great. we were able to watch the entertainment from our balcony if we wished to which is the most popular night entertainment on the resort free to watch and includes a childrens caberet. the swimming pool and the beach were clean. i would strongly recommend this resort to family and those requiring a relaxing holiday.

title: great holiday, loved this place!
review: The Es Ravell is a great place to stay if you want to be in the middle of the resort of Cala d'Or. The apartments are lovely and clean, the 1 bed is definately worth paying for rather than a studio as it is much bigger. The balconies are big and look over the pool area.  The complex is geared towards families, with excellent entertainment provided for kids, but I went with 2 friends and we had a great stay there. The bar and reception staff are helpful and friendly, and food is good.  Would highly recommend hiring a car and seeing some of the beautiful beaches around the island, particularly Cala Mondrago.  The noise from the Tropical gardens area in the complex is loud, and you can also hear the karaoke bar in front, but both don't really cause a problem as they both finish at…

title: excellent holiday
review: We stayed at Es Ravell D'or Apartments in July 2006 we loved every minute of our two week stay ,the kids aged 11 and 16 were entertained every afternoon and every evening by Ellie and Gareth you guys were absolutely fabulous you made our holiday,we loved the fun dances and joined in regularly with nearly everything you did.The apartments were spot on including maid service the beach literally is a 4 minute walk our rep naomi hooper was an excellent guide to what was going on in the area.Thank you all so much and hope to see you all in october for another week luv stan dawn scott and elise x

title: Good Value Holiday!  Good Hotel.
review: Stayed at this hotel for a week with my girlfriends at the beginning of May.  Hotel was pleasant.  Pool area very nice and the bar food is delish and all home made!  Although none of us had kids, the entertainers were excellent and all the kids seemed to be having a great time at the club/in the pool/at evening entertainment.    As it was beginning of Summer season the hotel was not as full as it would probably be at it's peak.  Plenty of sun beds and no trouble getting the same places everyday.  In the end everyone just stayed on the same beds each day so we all got to know each other!!  Every evening they would put on a show (e.g. tribute Robbie Williams/Westlife/Abba) - ABBA was absolutely excellent!!  Robbie was a bit dubious though!  However, it is worth staying in for the…

title: brilliant
review: absolutely brilliant, cannot wait to next year to go again.  Me and my boyfriend went for a week, first holiday together and had an amazing time, the only bad thing was coming home,   Apartments clean and tidy, bar staff helpful and entertaining, entertainers good fun, pool, bar and local ammenities all great. recommend it to people of all ages,our age band 20-30 plenty of late nite drinking holes and places to hit the dance floor, entertainment in bars under apartments finished at midnite so no problem with noise if you had young children in bed. amusements and internet access in local arcade to keep the teenagers happy.  Cala gran beach gorgeous clean, no rubbish, a must to see is tutti frutti man selling fresh pineapple, coconut and watermelon everyday.  all the restaurants…

title: Loved it!
review: Me and my boyfriend stayed at the Es Ravells D'or and had a great time!  The rooms were fantastic, a little small but as there was only 2 of us it was adequate!  The entertainment at night for us in the complex got a little tedious but there are lots of restaurants and bars only a couple of minutes away if you need to get away from it all.  Tropical Gardens, which is where all the entertainment is situated has lovely cocktails but the prices are expensive compared to nearby competition.  The pool area is nice and gareth & ellie did a great job of providing entertainment in the day.  The bar staff and reception staff are all really friendly and make you feel really welcome!  Would definetely reccommend it to anyone!

title: excellent hotel all round!
review: I have just visited this hotel with my boyfriend and we had a lovely holiday. The apartment itself was clean and tidy although compact but for the amount of time you actually spend in your room it was more than enough. The staff were excellent very friendly and more than happy to help, they also offered free electrical items, ie, kettle, toaster, etc which i thought was a very good service. The surrounding area is very nice close to all shops and bars and only a 2 min walk from the beach which is a beautiful cove. Our apartment was situated right above the reception on the ground floor the music was quite loud from the bar downstairs but we were able to sit on our balcony which was double the size of those in the upper floors, the music finished around 12 every night so it didnt…

title: Not bad at all
review: My girlfriend and I have just returned from a great week at this place and I would definatly consider going again. As it was a late deal we had to pay a supplement and got a 1 bedroomed place instead of a studio and it was more than sufficient for our needs, we were in block 4 (furthest away from the night time entertainment area which can be loud) and our apartment was lovely.  For a couple it was perfect, the bedroom was large and had a good sized wardrobe and then in the lounge (if you were travelling as a 3 or 4) were 2 single sofa beds and another wardrobe. The apartment had air conditioning which was much appreciated as the temperatures were high all day and night long and the kitchen area was clean and modern.  The staff are friendly and helpful and the pool and bar area…

title: not a nice hotel
review: Myself and my boyfriend booked a wks hol in may, and got the Es Ravell Dor hotel, after having a long trip to get to it, seem it was the last hotel on the route to drop off. The surrounding shops and area looked lovely ,as did the hotel until we checked in, The staff were very friendly, but when issued with or room key and the looking around for the number we were staying it, it had been raining when we arrived and there was water and puddles every wear near the room doors, so siutcases got very wet.Then we found our roon right at the end, near all the dustbins which some had over turned. Also very dark on approaching the room.When we got into the room we couldnt believe wot we were going to stay in, very dark and very small, nice cooking area and a lovely bathroom, but all we…

title: great if you like fun and have kids
review: We went in June this year, the hotel has good entertainment but geared towards children and is very loud. I can imagine in the school holidays it will be over run with kids............Which is fine if you have them, also kids above the age of 5 as sleeping before 12am could be a problem. Overall  has a very family feel, not suitable for girly or lads holidays.

title: very very very loud!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
review: We were disappointed with this hotel from the moment we arrived- the lift was broken for some of our stay the rooms were tiny and there is no privacy on the balcony but the worst thing of all was the competing noise from the bar at the front of the hotel with very bad karaoke and the "entertainment" from the tropical garden at the back of the hotel. The pool is tiny too and all the sunbathers get cleared away from the pool at about six to make way for the very poor Robbie, Kylie and Madonna lookie likeys while they murdered poor renditions of well loved pop songs, unless you enjoy unrelenting music played at top volume all evening and all night then this hotel is to be steered well clear of- another complaint if this is possible! is the fact that we were self catering and this…

title: best holiday!!
review: me and my fiance went on holiday to es ravells d'or in october 2005. we done allocation on arrival, we both were bit worried about the place we'd end up in. but to our luck we ended up in es ravells d'or. the rooms were very clean and tidy!! maids made a good job, they always came on time about 4 times that week. the food and drink at the bar were very good, but a little exspensive, i think that was because es ravells d'or had the best entertanment in that area. they had acts on the stage every night from westlife to madonna to blues brothers and even a great parrot show. they had kids disco from 8pm every night. also in the afernoon shaggy and steph ( hello ) played some music done some bingo and made it very plesant. shaggy is a top bloke! everyone would get on with him. steph…
